phrases: By mastering the katakana syllables we were supposed to learn after summer vacation,
I have become a little more adult.
Is this what it means to grow up?
I sense the world's blessings upon my newly-attained self.
Where did she pick that up?
Okay, let us try one a mite harder.
You do not learn that kana'til third term... or even second grade!
Since you read it right, this milk's yer prize.
Go show everyone how you can read that kana!
Children really do grow up fast.
But I never thought she was that into studying.
Three guesses, first two do not count.
Yeah, I just mailed it off.
Submit it to the Tokyo Kasho Exhibition.
This is my current self's calligraphy...
I would not send it if I was not confident.
I am all out of ink.
Thanks for helping me move in.
There is just about everything here.
They never let me eat any as a kid, since it was bad for me.
With Naru coming over to play, I should have some on hand.
Naru likes Kanro hard candy and Choco-Bats.
Maybe I will buy some in bulk...
Good, then other kids going to come...
It is cheap, so a peek would not hurt.
Sorry, I will pick them up!
You done swept the floor for me.
Cannot bend over lately on account of back pain.
Is not it because you are carrying that poodle?
Translation: What did you come to buy?
Translation: Do you have any thread( ito )?
Translation: Do you have any thread?
Uh, by ito you mean this, right?
But she kept sayin' itaka , itaka !
Old biddy heah got right bad eah'swell.
Translation: The old hag has bad ears too.
I do not know what you are saying.
Why are you gettin' so angry?!
You ended up letting me take it.
I can always grind an ink stick.
This does help, I have a deadline soon.
That is right, I remember about you drawing manga.
My work is nothing that great.
It is nothing to be ashamed of.
We both know about the fun of drawing and writing.
Would you... please read my manga?
I plan to submit it to a boys' magazine,
but I would like to hear someone is frank opinion first.
I am no expert on manga, so I could not give you any pointers.
I asked because it is you.
I want someone who knows the fun of drawing and writing to read it!
Is not that a striking introduction?
Is this for a horror magazine?
Is there something odd about it?
Should not it have more of the usual boys' magazine stuff?
The one whose name is written bursts apart?
I will call it the Snuff Note.
If I sent in a typical honor and justice manga, nobody would read it!
A protagonist on the dark side!
A complex bromance with a close friend who is actually the enemy!
A heroine who naturally fades out after just one chapter!
Society demands story elements it has never seen before!
Like having the heroine's best friend's grandpa as the final boss!
W-Well, considering the current trends, I guess it is a good manga
Please read it to the very end.
If it is no good, tell me!
Be honest, even if you do not think I can handle the truth!
You do not really want to hear it!
I am not getting involved with manga artists ever again.
I would only told Miwa-chan that I planned to be a manga artist someday.
But then I got carried away and even showed him my manuscript!
What will I do if Sensei tells the villagers about it?
The whole village will find out I am a geek!
A complex bromance with a close friend who is actually the enemy!
A heroine who naturally fades out!
They might not just think I am a geek...
Fujoshi (Rotten Girl): a woman who prefers novels and manga that depict male-male romances.
They will think I am a fujoshi!
Fujoshi (Rotten Girl): a woman who prefers novels and manga that depict male-male romances.
Related: BL (Boys Love), Yaoi, Fudanshi(Rotten Boy)
Fujoshi (Rotten Girl): a woman who prefers novels and manga that depict male-male romances.
Related: BL (Boys Love), Yaoi, Fudanshi(Rotten Boy) Formula: Girl Who Likes Manga Fujoshi
I just love manga, is all!
I am not some vulgar fujoshi!
You do not look so good.
No, just thinking about how girls these days can be really passionate.
And how I have to grind all my ink from now on.
So you could not buy ink?
They have penmanship homework for summer vacation, so ink sells out right away.
I brought you this worn-out bottle we had at home.
If I do not clear up the misunderstanding,
and get falsely accused of being a fujoshi,
I will no longer be able to live in this village.
I will tell him, When I said I wanted to be a manga artist, I really meant a novelist.
Could I have mistakenly lent him my most secret book?!
It happened my first year of middle school...
Tama, you got some manga from one of your cousins.
Now I am traumatized for life!
So that I would never forget what occurred that day, I have secured that manga!
I keep it separate from the others,
so I could not have accidentally lent it out.
In any case, I must protect my reputation as a proper, literary girl!
I did not expect my foot to slip...
Okay, okay, just get your balance back already!
I was so happy about the ink, that I got a little dizzy.
You are going to conk your head and die at some point!
You have brought champon a lot lately.
What am I doing over here?
We got noodles as a midsummer gift.
There is no way it could have failed to win!
What is with this stagnant air?
Sensei says he got second place in the calligraphy contest.
Oh yeah... he was talkin' about bein' in a calligraphy exhibit.
Are not second place still pretty great?
He says, first place went to an eighteen-year-old newbie.
What, yer sulkin'because you lost to someone younger?
Do you know how much time and energy I put into that writing!?
I even went without sleep to finish it!
But I have fallen behind some guy who started calligraphy only yesterday!
I thought I would be able to write good calligraphy if I stayed on this island.
But now I am paying for having taken it easy.
I never should have come to this stupid place!
Looks like our timing was bad.
Why didn' you give him what for?
He even said we were holdin' him back!
Sensei has a lot of pride,
so using logic on him will just make him more depressed.
Let us leave it to Naru.
Didn' Miwa-nee and Tama leave unhappy with you?
Even middle-school kids worry about me.
Still, it is just so vexing.
Without calligraphy, I have nothing of value to offer.
But since I did not win, I am worthless.
Sensei, are you having fun right now?
If you are not, then let us go play!
That is the thing where you toss mochi after building a house, right?
I have never done it, but I still know that much.
I am going to pick a bunch!
Get ready, they are throwin' soon.
That is a mighty fine boat!
It is actually good luck to name a boat after the eldest daughter.
But we are not got no daughters.
I am going to toss a ton yer way, Naru!
That is enough, just get scoopin'!
I was studying, but these guys dragged me here.
After he shrewdly grabbed a glove.
If I am doing anything, I am doing it seriously.
Are not going to lose, huh?
Let us just focus on pickin' mochi.
In order to get a lot, you must keep away from the two professionals.
She has long years of mochi-picking experience.
She will snatch mochi you have already picked, so stay'way from her.
Beyond that, we just have to show our stuff.
I will go up front to make a catch...
Go at it with your usual guts, Sensei.
What do you mean, my usual...?
So in the end, it is the same here too, huh?
Some can get them, and some cannot.
Rather than struggle, would not it be more gracious to stop trying altogether?
Maybe yer just bad at it.
It is no good if yer always lookin' up.
And take it once it hits the ground.
You find a mess of opportunities fallen below.
Are not many left now, but keep tryin'.
What should I do if I still cannot get any?
There is some guy better than me,
so what if I cannot pick mochi at all?
Let'er go, and try for a plumper mochi.
Was that really for the best...?
Sensei, how many did you pick?
He did not pick a single one.
Meanwhile, the grown man got zero...
but afterwards, she drops off food like this.
She gets a lot to distribute them to people who could not make it to the picking.
Even so, don' lose next time.
today was kind of fun for me.
You do not look at all like an educator.
I use'them as bait for rock snapper.
Naru, if you allow it, you can eat snapper.
Schoolmaster, how d'you use them as bait?
You pull off their claws, like this.
